{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[506]] &ndash; [[Alaric II]], eighth king of the [[Visigoths]] promulgates the [[Breviary of Alaric]] (''Breviarium Alaricianum'' or ''Lex Romana Visigothorum''), a collection of "[[Roman law]]".
* [[865]] &ndash; The [[Battle of the Morcuera]] took place in the context of the [[Spanish Reconquista]]. The battle took place at Hoz de la Morcuera near [[Miranda de Ebro]]. The battle pitted the Christian forces of Castile and Asturias under [[Rodrigo of Castile]] against the forces of the [[Emirate of Cordoba]] under [[Muhammad I of Córdoba]] resulting in a decisive Cordoban victory.
* [[962]] &ndash; ''[[Translatio imperii]]'': [[Pope John XII]] crowns [[Otto I, Holy Roman Emperor]], the first [[Holy Roman Emperor]] in nearly 40 years.
*[[1032]] &ndash; [[Conrad II, Holy Roman Emperor]] becomes King of [[Burgundy (region)|Burgundy]].
*[[1141]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Lincoln (1141)|Battle of Lincoln]], at which King [[Stephen of England|Stephen]] was defeated and captured by the allies of [[Empress Maud|Empress Matilda]], presenting her with the unfulfilled opportunity to become the first queen of medieval England.
*[[1207]] &ndash; [[Terra Mariana]], comprising present-day [[Estonia]] and [[Latvia]], is established.
*[[1461]] &ndash; [[Wars of the Roses]]: The [[Battle of Mortimer's Cross]] is fought in [[Herefordshire]], England.
*[[1536]] &ndash; [[Spain|Spaniard]] [[Pedro de Mendoza]] founds [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]].
*[[1542]] &ndash; Portuguese forces under [[Christovão da Gama]] capture a [[Muslim]]-occupied hill fort in northern [[Ethiopia]] in the [[Battle of Baçente]].
*[[1653]] &ndash; [[New Amsterdam]] (later renamed [[New York City|The City of New York]]) is incorporated.
*[[1709]] &ndash; [[Alexander Selkirk]] is rescued after being shipwrecked on a desert island, inspiring the book ''[[Robinson Crusoe]]'' by [[Daniel Defoe]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: The [[Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo]] is signed.
*  1848   &ndash; [[California Gold Rush]]: The first ship with [[Han Chinese|Chinese]] immigrants arrives in [[San Francisco]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; Pro-Imperial forces [[Fall of Osaka castle|captured]] [[Osaka Castle]] from the [[Tokugawa shogunate]] and burned it to the ground.
*[[1876]] &ndash; The [[National League|National League of Professional Baseball Clubs]] of [[Major League Baseball]] is formed.
*[[1887]] &ndash; In [[Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania]] the first [[Groundhog Day]] is observed.
*[[1899]] &ndash; The Australian Premiers' Conference held in [[Melbourne]] decides to locate Australia's capital city, [[Canberra]], between Sydney and [[Melbourne]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; Funeral of [[Queen Victoria]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Grand Central Terminal]] is opened in New York City.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[Charlie Chaplin]]'s first film appearance, [[Making a Living]] premiered.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Tartu (Russian–Estonian)|Tartu Peace Treaty]] is signed between [[Estonia]] and Russia.
*  1920   &ndash; France occupies [[Klaipėda|Memel]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; ''[[Ulysses (novel)|Ulysses]]'' by [[James Joyce]] is published.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[1925 serum run to Nome|Serum run to Nome]]: [[Dog sled]]s reach [[Nome, Alaska]] with [[diphtheria]] serum, inspiring the [[Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race|Iditarod]] race.
*[[1933]] &ndash; Working as maids, the sisters [[Christine and Lea Papin]] murder their employer's wife and daughter in [[Le Mans]], France. The case is the subject of a number of French films and plays.
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Export-Import Bank of the United States]] is incorporated.
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Leonarde Keeler]] tests the first [[polygraph machine]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Stalingrad]] comes to [[Battle_of_Stalingrad#Soviet_victory|conclusion]] as [[Red Army|Soviet]] troops accept the surrender of 91,000 remnants of the [[Axis powers|Axis forces]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Iskander Mirza]] of [[Pakistan]] lays the foundation-stone of the [[Guddu Barrage]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Dyatlov Pass incident]]
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Pakistan]] suggests a six-point agenda with [[Kashmir]] after the [[Indo-Pakistani War of 1965]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Idi Amin]] replaces [[President of Uganda|President]] [[Milton Obote]] as leader of [[Uganda]].
*  1971   &ndash; The international [[Ramsar Convention]] for the conservation and sustainable utilization of [[wetland]]s is signed in [[Ramsar, Mazandaran]], [[Iran]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; The British [[embassy]] in [[Dublin]] is destroyed in protest at [[Bloody Sunday (1972)|Bloody Sunday]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; The [[F-16 Fighting Falcon]] flies for the first time.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[Groundhog Day gale of 1976|Groundhog Day gale]] hits the north-eastern United States and south-eastern Canada.
*[[1980]] &ndash; Reports surface that the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] is targeting allegedly corrupt [[Congress of the United States|Congressmen]] in the [[Abscam]] operation.
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[February 1982 Hama massacre]]: the government of [[Syria]] attacks the town of [[Hama]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; After the 1986 [[People Power Revolution]], the [[Philippines]] enacts a new [[Constitution of the Philippines|constitution]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Auntie Anne's]] is founded by [[Anne F. Beiler]] in [[Lancaster, Pennsylvania]]
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Soviet war in Afghanistan]]: The last [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] armoured column leaves [[Kabul]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Apartheid]]: [[F. W. de Klerk]] [[Speech at the Opening of the Parliament of South Africa, 1990|announces]] the unbanning of the [[African National Congress]] and promises to release [[Nelson Mandela]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; First [[digital cinema]] projection in Europe (Paris) realized by Philippe Binant with the DLP CINEMA technology developed by [[Texas Instruments]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; Swiss [[tennis]] player [[Roger Federer]] becomes the [[List of ATP number 1 ranked singles players|No. 1 ranked men's singles player]], a position he will hold for a record [[ATP World Tour records#ATP Rankings|237 weeks]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; The worst [[2007 Jakarta flood|flooding]] in Indonesia in 300 years begins.
